summary: This is an OIG memorandum documenting the voluntary interview of a Federal Bureau of Prisons Senior Officer Specialist regarding the events surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York. The SOS details his shift assignments, procedures in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), and states he was not informed that Epstein required a new cellmate after his previous one was released on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the investigation. The interview focuses on the events and procedures at MCC New York leading up to his death.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate in the SHU who was released from custody on August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein's death.

persons.name: Senior Officer Specialist
persons.context: The BOP officer being interviewed. He was assigned to the SHU Day Watch and worked the shift on August 9, 2019. He states he was not informed that Epstein needed a new cellmate after Reyes's release.

persons.name: Captain
persons.role: BOP Captain at MCC New York
persons.context: MCC New York leadership. The SOS states staff shared concerns about staffing and rounds with this captain, but nothing changed.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.role: BOP Lieutenant at MCC New York
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who did not inform the SOS that Epstein required a new cellmate.

persons.name: SOS
persons.context: A colleague of the interviewee. The SOS stated this colleague may have told him Reyes left the SHU, but did not inform him Reyes was released or that Epstein needed a new cellmate.

persons.name: Correctional Officer
persons.context: An officer present in the SHU when the interviewee left his shift at 4pm on August 9, 2019.

connections.description: Reyes was Epstein's cellmate in the Special Housing Unit prior to being released on August 9, 2019.
The SOS was assigned to the SHU where Epstein was held. He had minimal interaction, escorting him once and providing basic items.
The SOS states staff, including himself, shared concerns about staffing and procedures with Captain, but no changes were made.
A fellow Senior Officer Specialist. The interviewee states this colleague may have mentioned Reyes leaving the unit but did not convey critical information about Epstein needing a new cellmate.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day Before Death
events.description: The SOS worked an overtime shift and then his regular SHU day shift. Epstein was in an attorney conference room the entire day and did not return to the SHU. His cellmate, Efrain Reyes, was released from custody.

events.title: Epstein's Initial Suicide Attempt
events.description: The SOS learned about Epstein's initial suicide attempt upon returning to MCC New York after completing military orders in July 2019.

keyFacts: The interviewed BOP Senior Officer Specialist states he was not informed that Jeffrey Epstein required a new cellmate after Efrain Reyes was released on August 9, 2019, contradicting potential claims by others.
The SOS describes abysmal staffing levels and procedural difficulties at MCC New York's SHU, making strict 30-minute inmate checks impossible on shower days (Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays).
The SOS confirms Epstein was in an attorney conference room for the entire duration of his shift on August 9, 2019, and never returned to the SHU cell that day.
The SOS states that log sheets for inmate checks were sometimes filled out after the fact or not filled out accurately, and leadership was aware of these issues.
The SOS was on frequent military orders, including for approximately half of his three-month SHU rotation, and learned of Epstein's prior suicide attempt only after returning from orders.
